columns.name: DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: Database domain where this data is stored.

columns.name: INSERT_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data insert user.

columns.name: INSERT_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of data insert.

columns.name: UPDATE_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data update user.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of the most recent data update.

columns.name: LOCATION_GID
columns.description: The GID for the location.  The Location Transport Handling Unit Capacity capabilities are used to define the transport handling unit capacity for a location and location role combination.   For example, ship units being delivered to Location A can have a maximum of 1000 pounds when packed into transport handling unit XYZ. However, the same ship units loaded into transport handling unit ABC can have 2000 pounds. You could also define another transport handling unit whose constraints are based on size rather than weight. Note: The capabilities related to the Location Transport Handling Unit Capacity are only checked/applicable for the destination location. They are not considered for the source location.

columns.name: LOCATION_ROLE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the location role.

columns.name: TRANSPORT_HANDLING_UNIT_GID
columns.description: The GID for the transport handling unit.

columns.name: MAX_LENGTH
columns.description: Value for the maximum length of the  transportation handling unit. Note: The Max Width field (as well as the Max Length and Max Height fields) are different from the Max Weight and Max Volume fields that are used to constrain the ship unit. The Max Width (and Length and Height) are used to check against each packaging unit or packaged item, not the ship unit.

columns.name: MAX_LENGTH_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the maximum length.

columns.name: MAX_LENGTH_BASE
columns.description: Value for maximum length in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: MAX_WIDTH
columns.description: Value for the maximum width of the  transportation handling unit. Note: The Max Width field (as well as the Max Length and Max Height fields) are different from the Max Weight and Max Volume fields that are used to constrain the ship unit. The Max Width (and Length and Height) are used to check against each packaging unit or packaged item, not the ship unit.

columns.name: MAX_WIDTH_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the maximum width.

columns.name: MAX_WIDTH_BASE
columns.description: Value for maximum width  in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: MAX_HEIGHT
columns.description: Value for the maximum height of the  transportation handling unit. Note: The Max Width field (as well as the Max Length and Max Height fields) are different from the Max Weight and Max Volume fields that are used to constrain the ship unit. The Max Width (and Length and Height) are used to check against each packaging unit or packaged item, not the ship unit.

columns.name: MAX_HEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the maximum width.

columns.name: MAX_HEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: Value for maximum width  in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: MAX_WEIGHT
columns.description: Value for the maximum weight of the  transportation handling unit.

columns.name: MAX_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the maximum weight.

columns.name: MAX_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: Value for maximum weight  in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: MAX_VOLUME
columns.description: Value for the maximum volume of the  transportation handling unit.

columns.name: MAX_VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the maximum volume.

columns.name: MAX_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: Value for maximum volume  in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: IS_FULLY_LAYERED
columns.description: You should select the Fully Layered check box if this location only takes a full-layered ship unit based on the TiHi definition. A full-layered ship unit has no partial layers. For example, you are packing 23 boxes into a given PALLET (THU) and the TiHi specified for the pallet is 6 x 4. Normally, you would pack them onto one pallet with 3 full layers and one partial layer of 5 boxes. However, if you allow only full layers, you would pack only 3 full layers and leave the remaining 5 to pack with other items. Building a full layered ship unit, when required, would only be honored when a ship unit is building from a single order release line using the AUTO CALC ship unit building method. It will not be honored when ship unit is built from multiple order release lines even when those lines have the same packaged item.
